snippet: As a deal to break a budget impasse failed to emerge on Friday, both the president and his Republican adversaries said they would not carry the fight over the cuts into the coming effort to finance the government.
abstract: Pres Obama and Congressional leaders fail to stop deep, automatic cuts in federal spending that will immediately shrink size and ambition of government; Obama criticizes cuts as foolish, but both he and Republicans agree not to carry fight over into coming legislative effort to finance government.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JONATHAN WEISMAN

lead_paragraph: As a deal to break a budget impasse failed to emerge on Friday, both the president and his Republican adversaries said they would not carry the fight over the cuts into the coming effort to finance the government.

headline.main: As Cuts Arrive, Parties Pledge to Call Off the Budget Wars
headline.print_headline: Washington Fails To Reach A Deal To Head Off Cuts
